title: Understanding Aggregation
text: Aggregation involves summarizing data points. Grouping by a field combines rows with similar values in one field to calculate totals, averages, counts, etc. Usually, aggregation functions like SUM, AVG, COUNT can be applied to grouped data.

hintAnswer: They are considered distinct entities since they are in different counties.
title: Discerning Differences between Cities and Counties
text: What happens when two places have the same city name but are located in different counties?

title: Why Use Multiple Groupings
text: When you have data categorized by both cities and counties, grouping by both instead of just one helps preserve details specific to combinations of these fields.

hintAnswer: To distinguish Hart in Bell county from Hart in Joshua county
title: Applying the Concept to Jamal's Database
text: In Jamal's database, the city of Hart exists in both Bell and Joshua counties. What should be the reason for grouping by both city and county?
choices: To order the results first by county and then by city
>To eliminate the state field from the results
>To distinguish Hart in Bell county from Hart in Joshua county
